meaning: To initiate social interaction and conversation
example: The host told a funny joke to break the ice at the party.

meaning: To endure a painful situation with courage
example: I hate going to the dentist, but I just have to bite the bullet.

meaningTR: Çok kolay bir şey, çocuk oyuncağı
example: The exam was a piece of cake; I finished it quickly.

idiom: Hit the nail on the head
meaning: To describe exactly what is causing a problem
example: You hit the nail on the head when you said we need better communication.
pronunciation: hit dı neyl on dı hed

idiom: Let the cat out of the bag
example: Don't let the cat out of the bag about the surprise party!
pronunciation: let dı ket aut ov dı beg

example: Come on, spill the beans! What happened?
I'm feeling a bit under the weather today.

idiom: Cost an arm and a leg
example: That designer bag costs an arm and a leg.
pronunciation: kost en arm end e leg

example: I only eat fast food once in a blue moon.

idiom: The ball is in your court
meaning: It is your turn to make a decision
example: I've made my offer; now the ball is in your court.
pronunciation: dı bol iz in yor kort

idiom: Kill two birds with one stone
meaning: To accomplish two things at once
example: By walking to work, I kill two birds with one stone.
pronunciation: kil tuu börds vit van stoun

meaning: To avoid talking about something directly
example: Stop beating around the bush and tell me the truth.

meaning: Something bad that turns out to be good
meaningTR: Kötü görünen ama iyi sonuçlanan şey
example: Losing that job was a blessing in disguise.

meaning: What you do is more important than what you say
example: He says he loves her, but actions speak louder than words.

idiom: Every cloud has a silver lining
meaning: There is something good in bad situations
example: I know you're sad, but every cloud has a silver lining.
pronunciation: evri klaud hez e silvır layning

example: The party got out of hand when too many people came.

meaningTR: Bir elin nesi var, iki elin sesi var
example: Don't just blame him; it takes two to tango.
I know it's hard, but keep your chin up!
If you don't apply soon, you'll miss the boat.

meaning: You must work hard to succeed
example: The workout is tough, but no pain, no gain!
She's been on cloud nine since she got the job.
Relax, I was just pulling your leg!
Take an umbrella—it's raining cats and dogs!

meaning: Said when the person you were talking about appears
meaningTR: İti an, çomağı hazırla (tam bahsettiğimiz kişi geldi)
example: Speak of the devil! We were just talking about you.

meaning: The final problem that makes you lose patience
example: Being late again was the last straw for my boss.
He'll clean his room when pigs fly!
It's getting late; let's call it a day.

meaning: Get to the point without wasting time
example: Let me cut to the chase: we need more money.

meaning: Something gained easily can be lost easily
meaningTR: Kolay gelen kolay gider, haydan gelen huya gider
example: He won money gambling but lost it—easy come, easy go.

meaning: To become too nervous to do something
example: He got cold feet before the wedding.
I'm tired; I'm going to hit the sack.

meaning: In trouble or a difficult situation
meaningTR: Başı dertte olmak, zor durumda olmak
example: She's in hot water with her parents.
Can you keep an eye on my bag?

meaning: To have just enough money for essentials
example: It's hard to make ends meet these days.
Horror movies are not my cup of tea.
Out of the blue, my old friend called me.

meaningTR: Zaman çabuk geçiyor, zaman uçup gidiyor
example: Time flies when you're having fun!

meaning: Don't give up during a hard time
example: I know it's tough, but hang in there!

meaningTR: Aynı durumda olmak, aynı kaderi paylaşmak
example: We're all in the same boat with these new rules.

meaning: To learn the basics of something
example: It takes time to learn the ropes at a new job.

meaning: To improvise; decide as you go
meaningTR: Duruma göre hareket etmek, plansız gitmek
example: We don't have a plan; let's play it by ear.

idiom: Take it with a grain of salt
example: He exaggerates, so take it with a grain of salt.
pronunciation: teyk it vit e greyn ov solt

meaningTR: İyi günde kötü günde, her koşulda
example: My friend has been with me through thick and thin.
After months of trying, she threw in the towel.
Our vacation plans are still up in the air.
The experiment failed, so we're back to square one.
After lying, he had to face the music.

meaning: To organize yourself and do better
example: You need to get your act together for the exam.
He's head over heels for her.
In a nutshell, the project was successful.
